[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_session()] [VM config tampering] Can self.env.vm_config() be modified between MoveVmExt creation and new_session() call through shared references, allowing execution limit bypasses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_session()] [Resolver lifetime] Is the resolver's lifetime properly bounded to prevent the session from outliving it, causing use-after-free or dangling pointer dereferences? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_session()] [Concurrent session creation] Can multiple threads create sessions concurrently with the same or different resolvers, causing race conditions in shared VM state or caches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Function: new_session()] [Environment staleness] Can the cloned environment in self.env become stale (outdated features, old VM config) while sessions are still being created from it? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Genesis-to-production transition] Can genesis-only privileges (unlimited gas, unlimited storage) leak into post-genesis sessions through improper state isolation or config reuse? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [VM instance isolation] Do GenesisRuntimeBuilder, GenesisMoveVm, and MoveVmExt properly isolate their states, or can operations on one affect others through shared static state or global variables? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Gas parameter transition] How is the transition from zero gas parameters (genesis) to production gas parameters handled, and can this transition be exploited to execute expensive operations with zero cost? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Cloning security] Since all three structs use cloning (RuntimeEnvironment, Features, VMConfig, AptosEnvironment), are all clones deep copies, or can shallow cloning create shared mutable state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Chain ID propagation] Is chain_id consistently propagated through all VM layers, or can chain_id mismatches between builder, VM, and sessions cause cross-chain attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Resolver trust model] Are resolvers assumed to be trusted, or are there validation mechanisms to detect malicious resolvers that return corrupted state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Session ID uniqueness] Is there a global mechanism ensuring session_id uniqueness across all session types (Genesis, Txn, Prologue, Epilogue, etc.), or can collisions occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Version synchronization] Can LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION become out of sync with actual gas schedule versions deployed on-chain, causing validation to pass but execution to fail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/vm.rs] [Architectural] [Native function consistency] Are native functions registered identically between genesis and production VMs, or can differences enable genesis-specific natives to be called post-genesis? (High)
